page.title: 10AN UNUSUAL PASTIME.
page.content: There is a man in Raunds who makes walking sticks out of cabbage stems.These are very strong and look wooden.He first brought the seeds from Jersey,thinking that they would grow like an ordinary cabbage.However they grew to between 10 & 12 feet high.When it is this high it looks just like an laburnam tree.The seeds are very small about 1mm square.He takes the leaves off them to let the goodness grow in the stem to have a thicker stick.In his garden he also grows parana pears and red & yellow striped tomatoes & all his own fruits e.g.oranges,bananas & grapefruit.He used to own a shop in Raunds High Street for 54 years.He also makes his own stencils.He also owns the last hand-made brick made at the old Raunds brickworks.
